Gangs Bill: Why a new move banning gang patches in a private home is causing an uproar https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/gangs-bill-why-a-new-move-banning-gang-patches-in-a-private-home-is-causing-an-uproar/ 6ZQFUWYKAZFLLLSXVGN2TLPBJY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/gangs-bill-why-a-new-move-banning-gang-patches-in-a-private-home-is-causing-an-uproar/ 6ZQFUWYKAZFLLLSXVGN2TLPBJY/ Derek ChengShould it be a jailable crime to have a gang patch in your house, even if it's not yours? Sun, 15 Sep 2024 17:00:00 +0000 A new clause in the Government's Gangs Bill will mean repeat offenders of the ban of gang patches in public places will be put under a "gang insignia prohibition order", meaning they won't be allowed a gang patch in their home for five years. Photo / Duncan Brown
